conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true isometric/cutaway 3D model: extruded walls with thickness, visible top/side faces, perceivable room volumes, and the ceiling/roof removed to expose the interior.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion and cutaway; clean wall corners and readable interior volumes with minimal distortion.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout matches (open lounge/dining left, kitchen central, wet areas bottom center, bedrooms right), but the balcony shown in the 2D plan is missing and the garage massing/location appears altered (attached in 3D vs separate block in 2D), with some proportion drift (e.g., dining dimension differs).

interior_elements.notes: Kitchen and bathroom fixtures are present and reasonably scaled, but major furniture (beds/sofa/dining table) is largely absent, limiting room identity confirmation beyond labels.

visual_clarity.notes: Clear, readable geometry with good lighting and clean materials; however, prominent text labels reduce presentation cleanliness per rubric.

detected_errors.description: Balcony present in the 2D floor plan is not modeled/visible in the 3D render.
Garage configuration differs: 2D shows a separate garage block, while 3D depicts an attached/integrated garage volume, altering overall building massing/layout.
Noticeable proportion mismatch in the dining area (2D indicates 3.3 x 3.1, 3D shows 3.8 x 3.1), suggesting scaling drift.
Large text labels on floor surfaces reduce presentation cleanliness (per rubric).

summary: A clearly valid 3D cutaway conversion with strong volumetric rendering, but with key layout fidelity issues (missing balcony and altered garage configuration) and minor presentation penalties.
